content.raw:
I did a quick, rough performance test. I simply added:

```
    <physics type="ode">
      <real_time_update_rate>0.000000</real_time_update_rate>
      <max_step_size>0.001000</max_step_size>
    </physics>
```

To simply run it as high real\_time\_factor as I could. On default, the real\_time\_factor was between 3.3-3.85. It started around 3.5, then stayed at 3.85 for a while, then dropped to 3.3 for a while.

On this branch, the real\_time\_factor was between 3.5-3.75. It is hard to say, as it kept moving up and down, but overall the performance seems unaffected on my sysytem.

I did a quick, rough performance test. I simply added:

    <physics type="ode">
      <real_time_update_rate>0.000000</real_time_update_rate>
      <max_step_size>0.001000</max_step_size>
    </physics>

To simply run it as high real_time_factor as I could. On default, the real_time_factor was between 3.3-3.85. It started around 3.5, then stayed at 3.85 for a while, then dropped to 3.3 for a while.

On this branch, the real_time_factor was between 3.5-3.75. It is hard to say, as it kept moving up and down, but overall the performance seems unaffected on my sysytem.
